review: Great streaming device but, has a few bugs. First, remote is too small. It's constantly getting lost, or falling in between the couch cushions. It's become quite a pain always trying to find the remote. Second, the device has a tendency to over heat. If watching for a long period of time, the picture will freeze , it wants to reboot, and sometimes it just completely shuts down. I make sure I unplug my fire stick before retiring for the evening or the next day it won't work because its too hot.
author: Patty Pennell

review: luv luv it! I have the fire box in the main living room, and got this for my bedroom.  I don't really need "voice search" in there since I hardly watch TV in my bedroom.  It is great for the price, and all the apps I originally downloaded for the box can be accessed in the bedroom too. I didn't have to download all over again.  Just know that you cannot watch both TV's at the same time (or at least I can't, with my internet) because if I do, one or the other TV is really slow, it will have long spooling pauses, etc.  Other than that, it is great!! I used to pay over $100 per month on satellite, now I only pay $20 per month for the SLING APP (which is live TV), which has all the channels + a few that were "pay channels" that I normally watched on dish.  I can really see that streaming TV will eventually put the other companies out, once people catch on to this....!  I would have "free TV" altogether if I didn't have the sling app, who can beat that? Amazon Fire is doing for TV what Magic Jack did for phones! Plain & Simple.
